place_description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.

reviews_data.review_text: It's sad to see how the quality of Amelie has gone done so much. It used to be a go-to place for great French inspired food. Not any more, their baguettes are expensive and chewy, their pastries and food mediocre at best. Service slow. Today, it took them over 15 minutes in an almost empty dining salon to bring a piece of heated quiche, which was cold in the middle. So sad.
Cute spot. Fruit tart was ok, pastry was decent. Coffee was good.

Second time here after years, it doesn't disappoint in experience, it's a cool place to hang out and have a cup of coffee. I love the sweeties. Staff, like the French, are a little uptight but loving in their own way. I love the decoration all around, easy parking.
Beautiful bakery and great food

The person helping  me at the counter was very helpful. They listened carefully to what I was looking for and suggested the best option.

I got my wife the Turtle Cheesecake and she loved it.  I look forward to trying more desserts, they looked delicious.

A little understaffed with a bit of a long line to place an order for a pastry or coffee. But I'm sure they'll get that handled soon. Other than that, it tasted great. A lot of decor and things to look at. Very spacious as well and didn't feel like one of those cramped tiny coffee shops where you have to squeeze in.
This place has gone down hill. Limited menu and I guess they discontinued chocolate eclairs. Probably not worth the $5 + tip anyway.
Amelie's is one of my favorite places of all time, any city, any location. Best mousse cups I've ever had, best macarons in the world, and the atmosphere is like stepping back in time.

Wasn't the best french toast I've ever had, but the service was great and this is by far one of the cutest bakeries. So lovely to just walk around and look at everything. I would come back, maybe not for the french toast, but i'm sure they have great other options! It was not bad by any means, just had better the day before.

I had heard a lot about this place and I'm glad I  came.  This place has a ver eclectic atmosphere all things French; it's very chill and the music is very romantic and relaxing.  The pastries, the drinks, the food is amazing and the staff is super friendly, even during rush hour. Keep up the god work!!! Shout out to the barista Andres!!
Great crazy place.  First off, the food is great and the service is fun.  Get a pastry and coffee and just try and soak in all the querky decor.
We love you guys!

Absolutely stunning! The service was outstanding and you could definitely tell the staff wants to be here rather than being forced. They were calm and explained everything, and they were super attentive to customers and any questions they had. The food is beyond delicious and you can tell the person who made it loves their job. Finally the atmosphere was beautiful, calming, and perfect for relaxing and enjoying your meal/ dessert. The menu is diverse and has plenty of choices, so you're sure to find something you like. If I could rate it more than five stars, I definitely would.

My wife and daughter are huge fans so it was an easy option on a Saturday afternoon to pop out for a sweet treat with coffee and land here. Neat eclectic layout of furniture and several folks pounding away on laptops. Cappuccino was delish and as much as I wanted one of those mini pecan pies, the sugar would have killed my keto diet.
Delicious pastries but the dirty floor complete with dead cockroach made it hard to enjoy.

We eat here almost every weekend. While the food can sometimes be a bit inconsistent (especially when it's busy), the service is always phenomenal and whenever there is an issue, they are quick to resolve it with a more than sufficient solution.

Our go-to favorites are the spinach, tomato & mozzarella quiche, the buttermilk biscuit sandwich (seasonal), any of the soups and the make your own sandwich on a croissant. We also love the macaroons and the fresh bread!

The ambiance is terrific and it's always lively and enjoyable to stop in for brunch. Thankful for this Charlotte staple!
Bummer about the pastries these days. See cross section of "chocolate" croissant.

Love all the Amelie's food, pastries, sandwiches and treats.
Service is usually very sweet. This specific visit thw cashier messed up on what I had but once I figured it out I went and asked he quickly pulled up the receipt,  apologized and fixed it. They're very pleasant to deal wuth at all 3 locations normally.
This is one of my favorite coffee spots but it  does get unbearably cold on the inside. Sometimes I have to sit outside because of the inside temperature. Other than that, love it here

Used to love their food until one of their delivery drivers hit me with their van and then claimed it to be my fault.

Stop employing pieces of garbage.

I loved the atmosphere! The decor is so beautiful it felt like a French bakery and the music was nice. I loved the Turtle Cheesecake. The macarons were great too! My favorite was the PBJ (the purple one). The strawberry cheesecake wasn't my favorite, it was kind of too runny for what I would normally want in a cheesecake. But overall, great experience!
I have enjoyed everything I have ordered on previous visits but tonight, the lemon square changed my life.

The guy that makes coffee (barista) at Park Rd, answered me twice in a rude way, while I was trying to fix a mistake I made ordering online latte coffees,  instead of chai late coffees. And I told him I ve been having a good day, I don't know if you have a bad day but is not my problem. Hey try to answer something again to me and I say No no  in a louder voice.( trying to stop saying rude thing to me)

I came to him first trying to ask if he has the order, so I can stop him to make them all, but is when I received the first bad answer. So I go to the manager having a very good service and attitude to help me.

The manager and cashiier at the moment helps me in a great way! Good attitude!
Thanks.
Was happy to find a sister restaurant to mine

We come whenever we are in town!  They have the best pastries.   Mother's Day was hopping but they still moved people through fast.  The chicken pot pie soup was amazing - staff recommended and on point.
Lots of interesting old French prints and other memorabilia. Sandwiches were tasty, but everything averaged $18 per person for me and the kids for Sandwiches and lemonade
Regular here, great patisserie, looks like they stopped hiring barista, drinks are bad at this park road location.

First time at one of these was so fun! Love the whimsical decor and mismatched everything and the puns on the walls. Tiramisu was frozen and dry, but pistachio coconut latte was delish. Bf's coconut tart was decent and key lime tart was very tart. Can't wait to go back to try the pastries, we went near closing time so pastries were mostly gone
The best buttermilk biscuit ever! Amazing
Una Experiencia Increible
I ordered a blueberry lemon gluten free cake for a birthday! They did a beautiful job! Everything was perfect and the staff went above and beyond! Highly recommend!
10/10 adorable French bakery. Went in just to grab a coffee and sit outside to enjoy the weather. The iced salted Carmel mocha and the chocolate peanut butter cookie I got were perfect

First visit @10:00am. Packed house, but noisy for me. The service was good. The coffee was okay, did not care for the baked goods. (tiramisu, key lime & coconut tarts). Prefer traditional or homemade tiramisu with lady fingers, the tarts lacked flavor. Was not worth the $$ at all.
We spent 37 dollars for two small sandwiches and two cinnamon rolls. They sandwiches and cinnamon rolls were mediocre, and they grilled the sandwiches without asking.
One of the best places to get macarons. There food is delicious as well. I will keep going back here for the rest of my life for anything sweet.
Hey have the best desserts and are open at the best times
Delicious pastries.

Went to this location few days ago , me and my friend ordered a chicken salad sandwich , it wasn't what I expected , it was very plain , no taste at all , the bread was hard and not to mention the coffee taste like melted ice cream instead  , also the server yelled my friend's name so freaking loud to the point that me , my friend and our surroundings got scared , I had high expectations with this place since it's so popular  but first time turned out to be my last time . The environment look really nice , but the service and food needs some adjustments. :)

Nice cafe with a very relaxed vibe. I loved the ambiance here, great place to eat, drink and chat. I've been to this Amelie's and the one off E 36th street. This one is definitely my favorite of the two. It felt more cozy and less congested than the one off E 36th. The decor was less distracting with the service, food and drinks being just as good. No bright checkered floors or large replica Eiffel towers, just sweets, drinks and good vibes. The E36th local is definitely cool to visit but this one felt more like a cafe I could experience on the regular and less like a gimmick to draw in customers. I got Chai and the lemon raspberry tart, both delicious. Definitely coming back for that Chai tho
This is, imo, Amelie's best location. Ample space to eat, talk, work. Clean dining area. Pastries and food are "scrumptious". I always get a fruit tart
Great place to get coffee!
Went back today and had a much better experience than when I took the quiche.  This time I had the croqie monsieur, the soupe, a pastry and an expresso.  Everything + the service were perfect.

A group of us decided to play a game that took us to Amelie's at Park Road Shopping Center.  The manager on duty, Emily, was friendly and had a good personality.  There was also a dark haired gentleman out amongst the tables who was friendly and outgoing.  We enjoyed an assortment of treats and beverages.  We looked around at the different lighting fixtures.  We ate, laughed, and decided to return the next day with more friends to enjoy some celebratory, birthday treats.  If you are considering visiting Amelie's at Park Road, why not just go for it?  You may find a new, go-to spot.  Oh, and since we are macarons, it seems apropos to share this chandelier with you.

Very beautiful place
And the cakes are very tasty
We enjoyed being in this place
Spice cider chai latte
Amelie's is great!

Amazing! I have a new favorite place 
I got the bacon breakfast biscuit, a hazelnut macaroon, French yogurt cake, and a salted caramel mocha latter; I haven't eaten my sweets yet lol so I'll update the review at a later date.
The food was just okay, the yoghurt came without the granola, and the large cappuccino is more a regular one. The location is not cosy at all.

I came in with my beloved and we didnt know but they were closed at 9:00 we showed up a few minutes after and they still let us place an order (for the pastry items that were still in the case). We also got an amazing history lesson about Amelie's! President Obama had these desserts shipped to the White House and they were featured in the Hunger Games movie when Katniss was on the train.

Such a sweet experience here. My date night was exceptional thanks to Amelie's!

As a true Frenchman living in Charlotte, I tried this bakery for the first time this weekend and I can tell you that it has nothing to do with a true French bakery: very disappointed.
The prices are relatively expensive, the croissants not good, not to mention the baguette which is absolutely mediocre. It's an affront to my France to offer a baguette of this quality!!!! 5$ for a piece of defrosted plastic, I nearly threw up trying to eat a piece.
The only positive point is the atmosphere and interior decoration with our Eiffel Tower.

This location is almost always busy and the staff handles it miraculously well. I overheard another customer complaining about a moment of confusion, incorrectly theorizing that the staff was messing their order up on purpose and talking down to the worker trying to help them, and I wanted to express that I have always had the opposite experience. The one mistake in my many visits was corrected so quickly and the staff has always come off friendly and so extremely hardworking. I love coming here to read, talk kindly with strangers, and enjoy a good (strong) latte. Highly recommend.

My favorite bakery in Charlotte! Has many options with reasonably priced pastries. And are absolutely delicious! All the macaroons are gluten free and they're chocolate mousses which are to die for! They also have a gluten free bread option. Only giving a 4 on food for more gluten free options! Their staff is very kind and helpful aswell! 100% recommend going if your visiting or if youre just in the area and hungry!
Pesimo servicio ,  pago tanto para yo mismo recoger y tener mis platos, tenedores terrible

1. Food: I had the "chicken-pesto-goat cheese" sandwich and it was a very sad sandwich. Along with the sandwich being disappointing, it was brought without any silverware or napkins, just cut on a plate. No real presentation either.
2. Coffee: I had the tiramisu latte, tasted good but was served warm not hot. The coffee was also served in paper cups even though I was dining in.
3. Had a hard time finding a clean table to sit at.
4. The man who helped me at the register did a good job and was helpful.

First time visit yesterday. The coffee was primo. I had not planned to eat... but I dare anybody try to go through the order line and not end up with a dessert on their receipt. Amelies... that is not fair for us to even have to try and only get a coffee.  I had the pecan pie and it was yum. The servers were great and the place had a cool vibe.  Highly recommend and I will be back.  Amelies, please open a place in Raleigh.  Actually, please don't.

We went on a Saturday and service was pretty fast, aside from drinks taking around 10 minutes.

My friend got a croissant and the tiramisu latte. She said they were okay. My other friend got the almond croissant and a hot chocolate. She said the hot chocolate was not great and her croissant was too toasted.

I got the tiramisu, salted caramel brownie, and the quiche because I saw a lot of good reviews for the quiche.

I didn't like the tiramisu. It was $6 and a very small slice. There is a thick layer of chocolate in it that I didn't like and it was just pretty bland aside from the chocolate.

The salted caramel brownie was good! It was also small, and more like a fudge than a brownie but I liked it a lot.

The quiche was $8 and the biggest disappointment. It is a generous slice but I didn't want to finish it. I got the quiche Lorraine. I think the only cheese was on the very top of the quiche, giving it a hard texture. The overall texture of the quiche was just dry and unpleasant. The middle was cold. I threw maybe half of it away.

All of the staff members I interacted with were very helpful and nice. There was a man giving out generous free samples of bread. Maybe I just ordered the wrong things.
First negative experience at the normally great Park Rd location. 30 minutes to get my sandwich....a few people actually left without their food.
Such a cute bakery and coffee shop

So usually I go to the Amelies in uptown and they're pretty decent, but I wanted to try a different location and it was so disappointing. I got the caramel mocha and it tastes nothing like the one I usually order, and the milk was chunky?? Not sure what that was about. Also the quiche was burnt, so that was also sad. I'm probably not coming to this location and if your looking for quality food my suggestion is to go to a different location.
One man helping entire line which goes all the way to the door...at least 45 customers

After I paid, the barista rudely told me that it would be a 20 minute wait and that he didn't want anyone staring at him while he made drinks. Why didn't some one tell me about the wait before I paid?

Amelie's French Bakery in Charlotte, NC, provides a charming atmosphere with a delightful selection of pastries. The service, particularly from Ben Clyatt at the front of the house, is noteworthy for its warmth and attention to detail. The pastries themselves are a treat, capturing the essence of French baking.
3 hours before closing, they stack the chairs and the big lady yells at 17 people why they can't sit at a 4 top.

We were in town for the Panthers game and wanted to take our friends to experience the restaurant.  We were very unimpressed with the young lady who waited on us. Very unfriendly and unwelcoming.  We ordered iced tea as well as several other purchases.  We paid and were told to listen for our name to be called for the tea.  We waited and waited.  We watched an employee on the phone, we asked about the tea three times.  We were told to wait and they would be right with us.  It was extremely disappointing the manner in which we were treated.  Your staff needs inspiration and guidance.  Hoping this will be helpful to you.  Thank you.

Food was fine, my drink... 20 minutes waiting. I almost fell asleep. So, I get my "hot" drink (chai latte) and it's warm at best. Newly made! The layout here is crazy. How about a separate register for just drinks and more than one person preparing them??? Having just one person do this is why my hot drink was warm at best. Gotta find someplace faster in Charlotte.
Super cool atmosphere to come and hang out.

Amelie's French Bakery and Cafe is a delightful spot for sweet treat. The cafe offers a wide variety of fresh baked pastries and breads with French flair. The atmosphere of the cafe is warm and cozy, perfect for enjoying a cup of coffee and a croissant. I love the Parisian, "artsy" and modern aesthetics of the cafe perfect for first dates or simply unwind and treat yourself.
Super cute French bakery. Yummy desserts. Open until midnight on Saturday. Got an assortment of delicious treats with the family.
INDUBITABLY IMMACULATE 14/10 WOULD RECOMMEND dab on dem HATAS
I must say their almond croissant is simply the best! The flaky pastry, generous almond filling, and perfect balance of sweetness make it a true delight.

What they lack in knowledge of and having vegan options they make up for in atmosphere. While they have added one vegan desert option the main menu lacks creativity for plant based options and is performative with a leaf for Vegan and a V for vegetarian when upon a closer look it's not used throughout the menu. At least one vegan sandwich and one soup option that is available and in stock would be great.
Excellent food and service.  The sandwiches are awesome and I have never seen such a selection of pastries.
Excellent service,  the food was great. First time here. I will definitely  be back!!
Always great coffee served!  Good ambiance and courteous staff.  Ample seating.  Parking on premises.  Recommended
Lovely atmosphere but very noisy unfortunately
Desserts tasted old. It's definitely not worth the high price
Place is nice. Deserts tasted old. I threw 2 out of 3 desserts I bought. Workers refused to replace it

I've been to this place exactly five times. Each and every time, no matter what type of food I tried to order, they were out of it.

You almost have to purposely try in order to be that consistent.

The breakfast wrap I got was very mediocre, pretty much every ingredient was not cooked well and it could have used some kind of sauce. The real kicker was that you can actually taste the frostbite from the potatoes.

I regularly buy bread from them and it's pretty solid, so maybe just the breakfast wrap is a bad call. I'll update again if I return for a sandwich, but my experience here was what I would expect of a $3 fast food wrap rather than a $10 wrap from a place like this

Had the most annoying experience! My boyfriend and I both ordered iced lattes, mine with lavender. We received 2 hot lattes. Brought them back to the barista, and was met with "you didn't order iced but okay." Then received 2 iced lattes in cups so small they seemed to be meant for children and neither with lavender. We brought them back again and was met with "you ordered the smaller size and you didn't order lavender."  It was very clear at this point that the man at the counter needs a refresher on the system or he just wasn't listening. It was basically empty in there so he could definitely hear us and we spoke clearly. But she tried to tell us WE were wrong and no apology. Really rubbed me the wrong way and I won't be going back.
WOW! Magnifique! The food was delicious, wonderful service and atmosphere!
Amazing as always

Very good pastries, the place is located in an odd spot so it's semi hard to find the first time there. Gps takes you on a road trip. Don't go near closing if you like coffee anyway because you'll get an americano that taste like dish water.

Transport yourself to a delightful Parisian oasis in South Charlotte, where the hardest decision of the day isn't what to wear but which pastry to get. Paint this mental image: you stroll into a beautiful chill cafe adorned with colorful macarons and golden-brown croissants, and greeted with smiling faces.

With a cup of rich coffee or a glass of fine wine in hand, you savor each bite of your chosen delight. Whether you're here to work on your next breakout project, meet up with friends, or just escape to the essence of France, South Charlotte's own slice of Paris awaits your arrival.
heavenly. Amazing. Both atmosphere and food are magical

Since the closing of Noda's 24hr Amelie's, this place is my favorite spot to go to for lunch or a decadent treat. Everyone who works service here is so kind and attentive, and the food and drinks are always delicious.
Very Cool Atmosphere, Great Choices and Comfy!
Spent my whole check on macarons, brownies, chocolate mousse cups, and some excellent water! Ruined my appetite for dinner, don't tell mom!!! Belly full! #fulltank
I absolutely love this place. Such yummy food and coffees. Plus, they also have wine and beer. My favorite place

So I was in town for the Scentsy  convention and we just stumbled in this place. Let me tell you this place did not disappoint everything was awesome so glad we stopped in. If you want a heavenly treat sop in and see what they have.

This was my first time to enjoy Amelie, visiting a friend in Charlotte. Food, service and atmosphere were excellent. Terri brought our pastries out, and was so personable and pleasant. A wonderful experience. Thank you so much. Can't wait to come back!
Stop looking at reviews and go to this place already!!!

Tried this place for the first time and got a apple cobbler pastry and a small piece of strawberry cake. The cobbler was served cold and was not very good, I thought it was weird to serve it cold and hard. The cake was extremely dry and was not good. There was warm water to drink with an ice bucket that was melted the whole time.This may be how the French eat their deserts so maybe I'm misunderstanding which would be on me. The atmosphere was awesome just the deserts we tried were not worth the price at all.
What an amazing french bakery, great selection and very friendly environment.
We had lunch here on a Sunday. My sandwich was really good. There is not really service, it is more self-service. Prices are reasonable. The noise level was quite high.
My first time ever trying macaroons and I loved them! My boyfriend got apple something, I forgot the name. I'm not a fan of apples in desserts so I didn't try it but he said it was good!

Embarrassing this place calls themselves a French bakery. I haven't had a single half decent thing here. Their baguettes are gosh awful. Croissants are unbearably bad. At best this place is by someone who once saw what a French bakery looked like on tv, clearly no one here has ever been to France. Bottom of the barrel.
Amazing food and the decoration is beautiful!! I really loved and recommend!
I'm so disappointed with my creme brulee!

This bakery is amazing! The macarons is very tasty, they are soft and crispy, with a variety of flavors and fillings. The bakery also offers other mouthwatering treats, such as eclairs and tarts. The staff is courteous and helpful, and the prices are reasonable.
Good oats. Great vibes.
Wonderful atmosphere and great sweets!
Dessert and coffee, of course. If you need a break from that other coffee chain and enjoy incredible house made desserts, this is your place.

This is highly overpriced and over hyped. The fruit bowl I ordered was just scraps of pineapple and all cantaloupe. all of the macaroons taste the same and some were over cooked and a but crunchy. The creme brulee is disappointing and chemically at best. The sandwich was the rising star here. The croissant was flakey and very good. I am disappointed.

I was excited to try this place but my wife and I were extremely disappointed. We paid $17.00 for 2 tiny coffees and a hollow eclair.

We ordered the "white chocolate pistachio" 16 oz iced coffee, and 10 minutes later we were handed 2, very small, flavorless iced coffees.

The woman making the coffee said "we are out of 16 oz cups, so I gave you 12 oz. Instead" When I told her that I paid the full price for the larger coffee, she changed her story and said "oh no! I meant we are out of the 12 oz cups" and then she walked away. I still have no clue what she was trying to communicate.

I'll also mention that the coffee had zero favoring. It was obvious that she simply made 2 iced coffees with cream and sugar. Absolutely no pistachio or white chocolate flavoring whatsoever. When we got home and I took a bite of the eclair, half of it was Hollow.

Total disappointment.
Simply delicious!
Cheap food at a high price. It's OK; I'd give the food a D rating and the coffee C. The sausage was clearly microwaved because it was unappetizingly cold in the center. But the price was very high.

I have never been more beautifully overwhelmed than when I first stepped foot inside of the bakery. The selection seems almost endless, the atmosphere and decor send you almost straight to Paris itself, the staff are heavenly, the treats are divine, fit for the gods. This place may just be heaven on earth!

The coffee and pastries are so good! I have never been to France, but it makes me want to go. They did a phenomenal job decorationing the building. I love all the art and sculptures. It really enhances the experience.
Best bakery in Charlotte! Our girls love the macaroons!

Stopped in for brunch. Had bacon & eggs on a baguette  with mayo provencal. Good but bacon was a little under done for my taste. Mrs had chicken salad on a croissant. She liked it but said it was canned chicken?  Two cafe fourcette's and a cucumber lemonade to drink. Two pastries, tiramisu & napoleon. Both excellent. Drinks were very good, 4 espresso shots in iced fourcette was just what I needed. Very eclectic decor but lends to atmosphere. Bill came to almost $50 with tip. A little pricey for cafeteria style dining, get your own utensils and condiments. Worth a visit for pastries and drinks.

We have visited a couple different locations over the years and we're so happy to find this one. We've been here twice and the staff has been very friendly and helpful each time. Our favorites are the fruit tarts and the macarons (they're excellent), the chai latte is also amazing. The last time we came in we had the bacon, fig, and Brie tartine which was delicious, and the chicken, pesto and goat cheese sandwich. And it was all excellent. Though we enjoy the food, I do want to compliment the staff, service both occasions has been really great.

This location -- off Park Road -- is our go to location. We just wish it opened at 7 am, but we know staff scheduling is hard.

There are a few gluten-feee options in the pastry case -- they are not stored separately, but team members will take precautions when handling the items if you mention it's an allergy. The tea cakes are delicious -- they are GF!! The Salted Caramel Brownies are decadent (I usually split in half at least) -- and are GF, too.

They do have gluten-free bread for sandwiches, too!! All around this is a Charlotte establishment and worth the visit. If you're not familiar with this location, it is on the backside of Park Road Shopping center, near Rocksalt restaurant.
First time here and I have no complaints! I went with the half size of the berry salad, a half of the fig and bacon tartine, and a sparkling lavender lemonade.
The French macaroons are amazing  I live out of state and go out of my way whenever I'm in the area to get these macaroons. Honey, raspberry, lemon, pb&j. They have fun flavors and taste great!
White chocolate mocha could have had more coffee and mocha flavor, but a once off deal. Tarts were fantastic! Will be back.

Dirty location,  old pastries... how can you tell?  Everything is incredibly gummy and chewy and the macaron not only lacks in appearance, but is insanely grainy and thick... and the interior is hollow!  Terribly made and no eye to quality.... also tastes like the fridge it was stored in. The mini chocolate mouse cup tastes like nothing and the chocolate cup tastes like fake chocolate.
I've been to Amelie's on several occasions. Done. Overpriced, poor quality. The cheese Danish with strawberry tasted like it was from the bakery at Winn Dixie.
The best desserts ever!

Amelie's is a very popular place to come here in the Queen City. I went with some friends for breakfast and everything we ordered were delicious : Veggie and Ham quiches, Cheese danishes and pastries. I had a Chai latte and it was so good!

They have a lovely ambience best place to study or work. This cafe has a variety of pastries and sandwiches but creme brule here is just next level amazing. The creamy creme in it and the absolutely crackling brulee part on top hits all the right spots. A must try
Come eat at Amelie's... Ask for Chef Rod to sauce up your plate. Trust the process and enjoy your day at Amelie's French Bakery

First time here because I heard so many great things!! Julia was really helpful and accommodating to my diet restrictions! She recommended me the Amelie's house salad with shrimp and it was amazing!  Super nice place, great staff and amazing food!

The fiancee and I decided to have a pastry date at Amelie's! The service was impeccable and the staff were really hospitable! We loved the interior design and the ambiance of this location!

The bacon, Brie, and fig Tartine was absolutely delicious! All the ingredients complimented one another!

The lemon blueberry entremet was so unique, light, and delectable! It was such a unique dessert,  not overly sweet, and well-balanced!

The fiancee ordered the pistachio Eclair and it was good as well!

Overall, it was perfect for an afternoon tea date and all the baked goods were really good!

Yesterday my wife and I had the opportunity to visit this Amelie place. We were pleasantly surprised to see the beautiful decor and the atmosphere of the place. We have never seen a coffee shop so well put together. The array of chandeliers gives the shop a very unique look. Adam the manager is very welcoming and generous. He practically gave us a tour of the place and the business. He is a very good guy who is an asset to the organization. He makes you feel at ease and welcomed. I had the latte which was very well made to my taste and desire. This is a keeper. I recommend it to everyone.

When this location opened a few years back, I was so excited to have an Amelie's near my house!  I have been a huge fan of all Amelie's locations since the first one in NoDa was a single room and open 24hrs.  It was the perfect place as an Art student at UNCC to pull all-nighters working on projects, and my heart is so big seeing the expansion and success of such a charming and beautiful business!
The ambience at the Park Rd location is just as creative and colorful as all the others, and my eyes can always find a unique piece of decor to study and admire.  My top orders include the build-your-own sandwich, soups, macarons, salted caramel brownies, twice baked almond croissants, and seasonal pastries (especially in the fall!).
The only issue one might have when coming here is a long line, because it is worth it! Just make sure to get there early if you want the best selection of macarons!

We come from Pittsburgh where we have la gourmadine French bakery which is excellent...was hoping this was the same...nope. Our breakfast sandwiches were worse than McDonald's and our coffee taste burnt! So disappointed.
Great atmosphere and always good coffee. Planning to set up more appointments there.

Absolutely nicest staff!! Walked in and the staff were very welcoming and greeted us with a smile on their face. One of the staff members recognized that we're going through Ramadan (Islamic holly month) and said "Happy Ramadan" which I thought was very nice. I appreciate your services! we got coffee and lattes and had wonderful times

Big time chain with a cozy and cute atmosphere. There's tons of seating in a basement style venue. A lot of the pastry looks really good, but if you're specifically seeking out croissants it might be best to go elsewhere. They are shipped in from a wholesaler, lack color, texture, and unfortunately flavor.

Skip croissants but trying everything else might be better.
This is a great place for brunch or even more to satisfy your sweet tooth. Tarts were ok. Creme brulee was really good.
La nourriture ici est incroyable et les desserts sont magnifiques. ENJOY!
Fantastic pastry and friendly staff

Was excited to try out this spot, but was incredibly disappointed. The place was extremely unsanitary and I'm surprised I didn't lose my appetite. The employee behind the counter was wearing a large dirty construction jacket, which kept brushing up against ALL the pastries. He continued to touch his mouth, face and hair - then proceeded to touch all the food. Not to mention the baked pastries in the case had a long hair on top. I ordered a build your own sandwich with sausage, egg and cheese. The sandwich came out with a cold sausage patty, clearly frozen and put in the microwave....which was completely inedible. If you're not going to make your own sausage, at least make sure it's heated up LOL. I will not be returning nor do I recommend it to anyone.

My favorite bakery in Charlotte!  The eclectic decor is almost as much of an attraction as the delicious pastries and treats... Almost.  I particularly love the salted caramel brownies and the macarons.  Everything on the menu is both delicious and indulgent.  Enjoy!
My first time meeting up with local Salesforce professionals! Great location, yummy options, very busy but awesome service! Definitely coming back!

I recently bought the multigrain bread at Amelie's and it is delicious! For toast or sandwiches my entire family loves it. No preservatives - a plus! I am going to buy a few at a time and freeze them. I highly recommend it. And the staff at the Park Rd. location was excellent - very friendly and super customer service.

I'm going to try and be very honest here, because I love Amelie's and I wanted to love my experience today.

I am a born Charlottean who has since moved away, and I was back in town for a brief few days and I knew I wanted to show this place to my partner. The last time I went to Amelie's, it was the original flagship location in NoDa. I even took a small group of women there for my bachelorette party back in the day. I see now that there are several locations now and that the original has moved, which is very exciting.

The Park Road location recreated the original spirit very well and I felt at home when I walked in. It was a Sunday morning, so it was very busy. The staff seemed a little panicked, and the line was very long. We had ordered ahead and picked up our breakfast sandwiches when we arrived--they were ready to go and very yummy!

However, the pastry I had ordered was sold out. I was a little disappointed because it initially was "orderable" online, and I noticed that for the online ordering system for Amelie's, items that are sold out appear grey and unelectable. So I was able to select this one and order it, but it was actually sold out. Oh, well. The problem is, I have Celiac's disease and also some minor issues with almonds and chocolate. So there wasn't really anything I could replace that order with.

Here's where the service made me a little sad; when we went to pick up the pastries at the counter, the text we received told us to pick them up "at the bar," but they weren't at the bar, they were at one of the cash registers. It was then that we found out that the creme brulee was sold out. We asked the gentleman at the register if I could switch it out with something else, and he sort of snapped at us. He said, "Yes, you can do that but I can't help you, I have to get my drinks out," and immediately walked away. Didn't pass on the information to another server, didn't even really take time with us. I saw that he was working on coffee drinks and he seemed sort of distressed. He also attempted to hand my partner the wrong drink at one point.

I'm a former barista and I get the panic behind a backup of drinks. However, I just don't think this was good service. Bare minimum, he could have taken a little more time to be friendly with us or offer a different solution. We didn't feel welcome, just felt as if we were an imposition. It definitely wasn't the special, celebratory feeling I remembered from the original shop. If the staff is stressed out on a weekend morning, more staff should probably be hired and scheduled.

We ended up leaving with sort of a bad taste in our mouth. Now, anybody could see, the demand was high. There was a line out the door pretty much the whole time, which I get can be stressful on servers. But--yeah. We were left feeling disappointed.
The pesto chicken & goat cheese sandwich is so good!

Great food and pastries.
Atmosphere with all the different chandeliers  made it very quaint.
King Tiger Tae Kwon Do Tuesday's!  Our favorite after class treat...
Cute shop. Variety of fun dessert options
Very nice place to have good coffee and pastries, and chatting with friends.
Still awesome.

Why call it a bakery at this location when you're just bringing it from your actual bakery and then freeze and  heating it all back up. Nothing is fresh at this location. The quiche tastes like water from being frozen and reheated. I could peel the hard cold cheese off of my quiche. The cinnamon roll, don't bother it is dry and has very little cinnamon gooeyness. The eggs were boxed eggs and spongy, and they were also precooked. They were sent back with the cold bacon that is also pre made ahead . They came back now brown from the turbo oven.
If you can't pul off simple eggs and bacon, why offer it?
The cappuccino were good once we figured out the server doesn't bring them to you. Why am I tipping ? I have to clear my own plates and you can't bring me my coffee & food?
The kicker is when I spoke to the brunette female  at the counter  that I was told was the Mgr on duty at 12:30pm this day didn't care at all. Just let us walk out after explaining to her about our experience.  I know as an f&b Mgr myself you do everything to make the customer happy. She failed and should probably be retrained on basic customer service.

First the good part about Amelie's
The cappuccino was very good.
Unfortunately we can't say the same for the food we got.
My wife order the quiche and it came half cold.
If you pre-make the quiche, at least heat it up properly. The cheese on top was so hard and cold it just peeled off.
I ordered the brioche french toast with scrambled eggs and bacon on the side.
French toast was plain without any flavor besides the Syrup.
But the biggest disappointment was the bacon and scrambled eggs.
I mean pre-made bacon and eggs?
My bacon and eggs both came cold, so I gave them back, asking for fresh made bacon and eggs, and I got pre- headed bacon and eggs again. They were brown and crispy
For $35 I would expect at least fresh made bacon and eggs. Even Waffel House makes these two items fresh.
Maybe come back for a coffee, but definitely not for the food.

The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) is the world's largest and most powerful particle accelerator. It first started up on 10 September 2008, and remains the latest addition to CERN's accelerator complex. The LHC consists of a 27-kilometre ring of superconducting magnets with a number of accelerating structures to boost the energy of the particles along the way.

Inside the accelerator, two high-energy particle beams travel at close to the speed of light before they are made to collide. The beams travel in opposite directions in separate beam pipes - two tubes kept at ultrahigh vacuum. They are guided around the accelerator ring by a strong magnetic field maintained by superconducting electromagnets. The electromagnets are built from coils of special electric cable that operates in a superconducting state, efficiently conducting electricity without resistance or loss of energy. This requires chilling the magnets to -271.3degC - a temperature colder than outer space. For this reason, much of the accelerator is connected to a distribution system of liquid helium, which cools the magnets, as well as to other supply services.

Replacing one of the LHC's dipole magnets (Image: Maximilien Brice/CERN)

Thousands of magnets of different varieties and sizes are used to direct the beams around the accelerator. These include 1232 dipole magnets, 15 metres in length, which bend the beams, and 392 quadrupole magnets, each 5-7 metres long, which focus the beams. Just prior to collision, another type of magnet is used to "squeeze" the particles closer together to increase the chances of collisions. The particles are so tiny that the task of making them collide is akin to firing two needles 10 kilometres apart with such precision that they meet halfway.

All the controls for the accelerator, its services and technical infrastructure are housed under one roof at the CERN Control Centre. From here, the beams inside the LHC are made to collide at four locations around the accelerator ring, corresponding to the positions of four particle detectors - ATLAS, CMS, ALICE and LHCb.

Explore the CERN Control Centre with Google Street View (Image: Google Street View)

Bit too sweet pastries and not sure why they twice bake their croissants - why can't they just be soft, buttery and flaky ?

Really enjoyed stopping by here with my friend. The baked goods and sandwiches are fairly priced for the area as well as very tasty. The service is fast and the vibe is kitschy. I like that no one tries to hurry you out and you can definitely sit here to chat for a while or potentially cowork.
Muy buena atencion, y ricas comidas.

Ne mangez pas ici c'est une disgrace a la culture francaise. This is an insult to French culture and gastronomy. Do not eat the macarons they are stale and not tasty at all. The decoration is tacky and they can't even spell French sentences correctly on their shop signs. I am offended this place claims to be "French" when it's nothing but an American joke. Please save yourself some time, money and food intoxication and don't stop here.
Seems to be a lot of rules posted, that are mildly off-putting.

I deeply appreciate that they don't charge extra for those of us that need gluten free bread for sandwiches! The soups and sammies are as tasty as always, and still a decent amount of GF options for those that need it. Macarons and chocolate mousse cups are  The caramel apple French soda is not nearly as good as the creme brule French soda, bring that one back please!
Love Amelie's and this location is true to their atmosphere and quality of both staff and food.

4-5 stars for the food, 3 stars for the intermittent service.  I live nearby I've been going to amelies since they opened.  the minus stars is for the spotty service.  Sometimes its great, the food is good when they get it right.  I get a lot of food to go, it's about 60/40 on if they get to go food right.  Make sure to check what they gave you is what you want before you leave and you'll leave happy.  I've confirmed what i want on the sandwhich only to have them omit things i asked for and add things i didn't
The chocolate torte was excellent. The coffee is good. The ambience is very pretty. I was not happy with the macrons. They were hard and chewy.

First off I am a night owl . We miss the 24hrs of the original location.It gave Charlotteans a sense grit and authenticity Sorry it feels like walking into Disneyland . It feels too polished and sterile. No vibe that feels welcoming to artists, poets, skateboarders etc. We loved the "avant-garde" of the original location. The old piano, street performers and counter culture customers and staff. Way too overdone. It feels like a tourist destination now  the one place that was conjuring culture in charlotte and they #failedtheassignment

The manager of this location is EXTREMELY RUDE. After waiting almost 20 minutes for our drinks and finishing all of our meals, our drinks were finally called out and one of them was made incorrectly. The manager making the drinks literally said "fantastic. It will be another 5 minutes." Even though it was HIS fault he didn't follow the order correctly. I complained to the woman at the register and she said "yeah...that's the manager." As if that justifies his treatment of customers. I understand this location can get extremely busy. We get that, and we're patient. But, the least they can do is respect their customers. There needs to be better processes in place for those waiting for their drinks. It's one guy making them and shouting names and it's a large location. For those waiting outside they can't hear. Even for a simple orange juice there's a wait. Unfortunately we will not be returning to this location. It's just not worth the disrespect.

Appreciate you Adam!

Delicious baked goods, as always.
Best gluten free pastries I've ever tasted. Very friendly staff.
Excellent food, drinks, and service.

Delicious pastries and Sandwiches!
Beautiful and cool theme inside!
Kylie provided great, professional service and super sweet!

A gem of a place. Went to the original location back multiple times in the summer 2014 and I've been ranting and raving about it since. Flash forward to 2019 and they had one in Atlanta, unfortunately they closed after the lockdown.  Get your French fix of pasteies, croquet monisuers and cafe without going to Paris!
Have a chocolate madeline!
Great atmosphere, great food and awesome staff!

This really isn't the place to get coffee. I bought a cappuccino recently and it was made very poorly. The drip coffee isn't very consistent either. The pastries have gone downhill in my opinion. I was surprised to see a few items that really should have been thrown out. It's "OK", but it's not anything to seek out. There are way better bakeries in Charlotte.
Never disappoints!
Julia was amazing! 10/10! Thank you so much. Friendly and amazing team.

Typical American style French looking pastries. Had high hopes after reading all the reviews, sadly the pastries are mediocre at best. Ordered Napoleon, Silk French Tart, Chocolate layer cake, Almond croissant and Raspberry Lemon tart. All items lacked their supposed flavor profile, the only thing you taste is sugar and nothing else.

I am from France and this place would put to shame some of the best Parisien bakeries!
I wish they had places like this in Boston (where I live).
My bf and I are awe of the decorations! I enjoy their bakery and my bf order their lunch menu. They are delcious! The staff are extremely nice! Will come again!
I always enjoy coming here. The decor is amusing, the food is delicious, and the coffee is spot on. I highly recommend any of their locations.
Great atmosphere and prices are reasonable. The macaroons are big compared to the average size. I will recommend this location for a low drama date or casual talking.

This cute little (though not that little) cafe is such a must-go! The window delicacies are delicious! I had an eclair, a macaron, and creme brulee (which was heavenly).  I also had the Brie, bacon, and fig jam tartine (not pictured) which was to die for!
Amazing desserts and espresso. Great atmosphere beautiful art. The employees are very friendly. Great place to relax and talk.
Simply the most relaxing, cozy, delicious cafe experience in the Carolinas.

Great little French pastry and cafe.   We only came for some desserts and they were great.   A great variety and it was really good.   The decor and atmosphere could get you to think you were in an old France shop.   Treat yourself and go.

Love/hate relationship with this location.

Loved the vibes, the quirky French decorations, the staff. All are very fun and give you a 90's "Friends" feeling that I really enjoy.

I hated the food. The pastries were quite bad -- mushy and dull, and the coffee was bitter and quite bad. My companions got espresso drinks that were admittedly much better though.

It's worth coming for the vibes, but definitely not for the food.
Over cooked everything
Chocolate croissant chewy, like bread.

The owners have put a great deal of creativity and care into both the design and the execution of this delightful cafe. It was a perfect place for a late morning snack - the tartine with fig, bacon, and Brie. The Brie was melted just right over a generously-buttered baguette - perfect with a latte.

I would recommend taking the time to really enjoy the art and atmosphere- this is not a place to rush through.
The staff was rude today! The girl behind the pastry counter literally was upset that I did not know the name of some of the pastries. Sorry I'm not a full time pastry server...overrated
This place is amazing! You will not regret coming here!

Came here TWICE this past week because the parents were in town and recently discovered Amelie's. We really enjoyed both visits!

The Good: first, the ambience is super cute! Kind of reminds me of an antique shop with French flair. As for the food, we all really enjoyed everything we tried. We tried several macaroons and multiple tarts. The tarts were the MVPs as they were delicious and not too sweet. The macaroons were also really good but were too sweet for all of us (none of us eat much sugar so we're all probably too sensitive to it). We also got some crustless quiches and chicken salad on croissant. My favorite was the chicken salad sandwich. The chicken wasn't fatty or gristly and seemed to be all white meat, which is my preference. The croissant was also insanely delicious and not stale as other reviews have mentioned. In fact, all of our pastries and food both times seemed to be really fresh.

The Meh: service wasn't the friendliest (except for the super nice lady who brought out our food - she was awesome). The ordering structure is confusing for newbies (see below) and I felt like the people working the pastry counter were impatient with us. There's a lot to look at within the pastry area and it may take some time to decide. They weren't busy when we came shortly after opening but I felt rushed making a decision on pastries.

The Bad: if you're new to Amelie's the ordering structure/process isn't clear and is confusing. One person takes pastry only orders and if you want anything else besides something in the pastry case, you have to place that order with a different person at the register. I get it but clear direction and patience would be appreciated. Apparently, if you order coffee, that comes out in the coffee bar area and not with your food. I think they call your name when your coffee order is ready but, due to the acoustics of the restaurant, I didn't hear a thing. Eventually, after I was almost done with my meal, I went in search for my latte and it was sitting on the counter. It would have been better if the cashier had let us know to watch out for our name or coffee at the coffee bar but I expected it to come out with my food. Like I said, I understand the structure of the food, pastry, coffee areas but staff were not helpful in communicating the process.

Overall, we really enjoy the food and the ambience so we will definitely be back when my parents come back!
I always have a great experience when I come here.  The macarons are so good and the breakfast sandwiches are always delicious.  They also have gluten free bread which is a huge plus!
Poor quality of services. Food taste is good . Coffee was served very cold !!
A lovely cafe with good food, drinks, and atmosphere. I think everything is fairly priced, but the large pastries which are a little too high.
Lovely place in lovely neighborhood.
I absolutely love this place. My go to dessert is the pecan tart!
Great pastries!

Everything we ordered was excellent! Very enjoyable experience.  I HIGHLY recommend a visit to this place!

The only thing that I recommend to the owners is that they improve their hot and cold cups. The cold cup had a hole in the bottom and the hot cup collapsed when we took a sip.

The one star rating is due to very poor customer service and the inability of management there to professionally take into consideration legitimate customer comments. If it were not for decent pastries and good coffee, a zero star rating would be more accurate. However, the pastries are seriously over priced.

Amelies is not a good choice for those who only want coffee. The set up forces all customers to wait in what can be a very long and very slow moving pastry counter line. Even though there is potential for their second register to allow a separate coffee service line enabling better service to all customers, management refuses to implement this.

A friend I was with today wanted to bring this up again to the manager on duty and was met with obnoxious rudeness and unprofessionalism. The manager stated in a snarky tone that "it is what it is and that there was a Starbucks up the road if he didnt like it." I was shocked that a manger would act this way.

We took the managers suggestion and left. They lost 4 customers today. I will not give them my business ever again.
We use to have Amelie's on Atlanta and unfortunately is close. We were so happy to found it at Charlotte. Always excellent pastries and coffee.

I bought a cheese danish and a cinnamon bun. Both were stale and not fresh. I was so surprised considering my first visit was at the Davison street Amelie's bakery and everything was so fresh and delicious.
I'm giving 2 stars because the service was great and the ambiance looked inviting. I'm sorry to say I couldn't say the same for the pastries.

I was so excited when I walked into this location and couldn't wait to bring my niece to this location since we enjoyed ourselves at the Davison street location.

Because the pastries were stale and dry, I will not bring her to this location.
Great food, drinks and atmosphere.  Employees are very nice and welcoming. We'll be back.
It's all so good! Croissants are delish.  Tarts are great.  Real bakery. Great atmosphere.

Stopped here for a leisurely breakfast with the family - inside is eclectically decorated, and the pastries artfully displayed.  The wife's cappuccino was well done, my espresso unfortunately served in a paper cup (even though we got the order to eat in) and a tad more bitter than I would expect.  Our pastries were delicious - flaky sweet and very fresh.  We ended up getting some macarons for the road to hold us over until lunch!

Croissant was harder than a brick, palmier was low average, hot chocolate was a powdered mix, so, what's the fuss about this place?  You might be impressed if you never had better.  Nice ambience though.

Why is the staff progressively getting more rude? This used to be my favorite stop on the way to work there's a guy named Brandon working the register who has been awful and arrogantly talking to customers, I wasn't going to leave a bad review until I saw someone else complain about him too.

Excellent selection of baked goods. The salted caramel brownie was fantastic, the espresso was decadent and rich, macaroons perfect, and crem brulee was fresh and torched on site. I would give 5 more stars for the interior alone, eclectic and unique art. Stop looking around, this is the place!
Adorable and delicious! This place is cute and served up great quiches, sandwiches and pastries with excellent coffee. A bit hidden away, but that just adds to the charm.
Brandon, you're an a-hole I did not like your attitude don't work the front register

Terrible manager! We were there last week and ordered without a mask on no problem. Today we were treated like we had a terrible disease. Embarassing moment for me and the family and we will never go back.

It was terrible last week manager didn't ask us for mask and today all of a sudden it was "required" we was treated like criminals "We can't serve you" "You have to leave" omg I was speechless!!! Discrimination at 100% never expected this down south I'm disgusted !!!! I would put 0 stars but it won't post !!!! Shame on Amelie's I thought they was better than that!!!!

I don't know why, but I've reviewed this place like 10 times and my review and photos keep getting deleted.

We love Amelie's. Today, we took a family bike ride for breakfast sandwiches and macaroons! Staff was friendly, there are bike racks and outdoor heated/covered seating
Great ambience and very spacious for group of friends to hangout or work at. I never get bored of their macaroons and fruit tarts!!

i've been on the hunt for the best tasting coffee in charlotte. Amelies makes a pretty good americano & cappuccino. it's one the only coffee place around here I can drink without oat milk/syrups. they have amazing pistachio macaroons which is a french classic and my personal favorite. their sandwiches are great as well. I've been going to Amelies once a week for a year now and the staff has been 5 stars every time.
Employees looked and acted as if they'd rather be on a train track with a train coming than work there

My wife and I stopped going to Amelie's years ago, we found Burney's to have much better quality croissants, cookies and brownies.

I had to laugh when a buddy shared he experienced the same half-frozen Napoleon custard as I did.
The most pretty of the Amelies, super nice.

So my wife and I tried this place since we were in Charlotte. Saw the good reviews and said hey why not. Well....... I've never seen dark meat in chicken salad and while I'm certainly not a professional chef , it just doesn't work. Not to mention there were bones in the chicken salad. My croque  Monsieur was decent. The tea for being in the south needs to be sweeter. Staff were sort of friendly. Sorry that was just the experience we had.

2018:
Although I am happy for Amelie's recent expansions, I do have to say that the quality of their food - particularly the pastries- has gone way, way down. The croissants have no flavor and do not have crispy crusts, and their cakes likewise just taste like sugary bread. There's also a lack of consistency between the stores. :(

Update from 3 years ago:
The Park Rd. location pleasantly surprised today. The pastries (petit gateau and eclair) were moist, flavorful and robust. Delicious!

This is the second Amelie's location that I've been to and I love the funky decor!there is a wide selection of dessert options in addition to delicious food and drinks. But above all else, the staff is so friendly and kind.
The salted caramel bars and the cafe au lait macaroons are delicious!!
A free eclair on your birthday!  The mushroom(champignon) duxelle tartine is melted with gruyere cheese.  Their signature is the salt water caramel brownie, a must try.

Wonderful food, Staff, facility/ atmosphere!
Highly recommend, always a positive experience!
Very cute place with great pastries. Friendly staff.
Love Love this cute French bakery & cafe (also has beer & wine) - a true gem with great service, atmosphere, & food - unique & fun

Came here after a couple awful experiences at our hotel's restaurant and it was a refreshing change. I got the ham + turkey + bacon sandwich and my wife had a breakfast sandwich on a croissant. We also had the most decadent salted caramel brownie latte. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was great!
Great place, great staff, great bakery! Please come back to Atlanta...

Best coffee shop in town. The food and pastries are excellent as well. The staff is always nice and Allana specifically has gone above and beyond to make us feel welcome. Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to try somewhere new.

I have always loved this place which is why it's hard for me to leave a bad review. This is the first time I ever went to the Park Road location. Inside was very clean and quaint. Ordered an iced coffee (pretty good) and also ordered the chicken salad croissant and the chicken broccoli cheddar soup. The soup was basically broccoli with hot water. No cheesy flavor, and only one piece of chicken in the whole soup. The chicken salad was not that great either. I have always enjoyed their coffee and baked goods, but I don't think Amelie's has mastered prepared foods.

The pastry and banana latte were excellent! The service was amazing and the atmosphere is very eclectic. Unfortunately we came at a very busy time on a Sunday morning and had a bit of a bad run-in with the barista.
It was very nice to be able to sit outside in the sunshine with my friend. It was very disheartening to see that inside there was no seating at all.

I understand that popularity comes at a cost, but more than 30 minutes for one cup of coffee and breakfast sandwiches means this place is dead to me.

If you are in any sort of rush, I can't recommend coming here... On weekends at least.
Paradis sur terre!

I'm at a lack of words to describe how good this is.
Thank you for this experience.
Great as usual!

This hidden gem is a MUST!
I have visited the other location in NODA.
If you love French things, food, bakery, decor-this place is for you. An absolute dream. And the pastries!!!!!!! Gather your girlfriends, put on a beret & go experience this treasure!
Never felt particularly welcome here, I've gone a few times when I should've stopped at the first. Won't be back.
First time here and I was impressed! Great little bakery/ Cafe with indoor and outdoor seating. Delectable treats for someone with a sweet tooth!!

Hi Patricia!
I wanted to thank you and the entire Amelie's catering team for making our event special. Everyone loved the food and commented on how it was the best thus far.
Well packaged/ labeled, everything was as ordered, condiments, serve ware , all presented beautifully, especially the macaron, and deeelicious!
Please thank everyone and know that Grant represented Amelies perfectly - prompt , courteous, helpful and just a nice guy!
Yay Team Amelie!!
We enjoyed this location also. Larger seating area, same quirky decorations. Enjoyed our pastries and breakfast sandwiches.

Always clean and friendly.  Jason was especially helpful.  There was a miscommunication on my part with a drink order and he gladly took care it.  Great place for meeting and getting your creative juices going!
The food is fabulous! The decor alone will keep bringing me back. I love the ambiance in this beautiful French Bakery. The staff & owner is amazing! I'm hooked

Amelie's reminds me of a Paris patisserie. Great selection of fresh desserts that are very tasty. I highly recommend their fresh fruit tarts! There is plenty of room to sit and eat inside or out. The staff behind the counter were friendly and helpful even though I had a lot of questions. The quirky decorating was an added visual bonus.
Excellent food and drink!
It was so good can't wait to visit again!!
Clean, good staff, good pastries.
The deserts/pastries are crazy good and with a great presentation.
Their croissants are amazing...light and flaky!  Very nice atmosphere.
Great new experience! Cool museum-like cafe. Will most likely return!

Travel to Paris through the senses! The scent of a bakery and coffee greet you as you approach the cafe. As you step in off the street, your ear catches something different, the beautiful music of a mixture of language.  You step inside and realize, you have entered Paris. Everything from the delightful decor to the astounding pastry creations tell you you've transported to a Parisian Cafe.  You can pour over their menu, and debate the choice of which dessert to try.  But feel free to just order anything because it all is delicious!  When the food arrives you can feel the difference in your hands, the crisp of the bread, and the softness of the cheese. Then you eat...and it's heaven!
Fantastic little bakery and cafe. Very friendly staff with terrific range of treats and food. I'm saving this place on my favorites!
Nice vibe. Good food.
Very fun bakery with a very impressive menu. Took a while to decide what we wanted because I didn't want to miss out on anything. Food and pastries were good, so we will definitely be coming back!
Eclectic decor and delicious desserts! The apple tart was amazing.
Do not deny yourself this treat. Visit them and you won't regret it. They have so much room to sit. The food, the drinks and the deserts are the best around. Coming back was like coming back home.
Delicious food and friendly staff.
